result.execSummary:
The defendant Keith A Blanton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Imposed and Stayed. Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 3 years bifurcated sentence.
Conditions, if revoked, are as outlined in probation conditions.

miscConds.notes: Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law and must pay mandatory DNA surcharge. If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.
No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

Firearm warning given. Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored. Any assessments, counseling or treatment as deemed appropriate by agent. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.

timeConds.notes: Defendant to serve 30 day and the balance will be STAYED. Huber granted for work and treatment.

Attorney Wendy S. Paul in court.  Dirk Christian Jensen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Darlene Shue
Attorney Paul- Not sure why her client is not present. 
BTC: Bench warrant to be issued, will stay it until Friday February 12th at 5pm.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.

**AMENDED 2/9/2016 $350 to be transfered to ZCI to pay fees.

BTC: Bond modified to $450, then $350 be transfered to ZCI to pay fees. Report to ZCI after court.

Defendant Keith A Blanton in court with attorney Wendy S. Paul.  Antoinette L. Rich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Mark Garvin.  Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over.
Defendant is notified that his ZCI reports are coming back at a high level. 
Defense argues that the levels will be lower today when he tests after court today. 
State requests a cash bond modification of an additional $200.00. 
BTC: Defendant is placed on GPS monitoring. Exceptions are going to court and meeting w/his Atty. 
BACK ON THE RECORD: 
Defense informs the court that her Defendant is on probation and is be enrolled through a program w/them and would like the bond to be modified to include an additional $200.00 cash component and exclude the GPS monitoring. 
BTC: Bond is modified to a $ 600.00 cash bond. GPS monitoring is now excluded. DEFENDANT IS TAKEN INTO CUSTODY. 
  Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 18, 2015 at 08:15 am.
